rooms.description: Spacious entrance with ramp access for wheelchair users. Includes a reception area and storage cabinets aligned with Vastu principles.
Open concept living room designed for natural light, large windows on the east side to catch morning sunlight. Accessible design includes a barrier-free layout and lowered sections.
Adjacent to the living room, the dining area is designed for natural ventilation with sliding windows and an open plan that facilitates wheelchair movement.

Modern industrial kitchen with high ceilings and large windows on the south wall to enhance natural light. Designed with accessibility in mind, with adjustable counters and a wheelchair-accessible sink area.

A spacious master bedroom featuring an attached balcony on the east side for morning sunlight and ventilation. The room is designed to be fully accessible, with wide doorways and low-level storage solutions.
Additional bedroom featuring a dedicated balcony. Large windows for natural light and an open plan layout ensure wheelchair accessibility.
Another bedroom with an attached balcony oriented towards the north to maximize airflow. Accessible design features include wide doorways and a barrier-free floor plan.
A compact yet comfortable bedroom with a small balcony ensuring natural light. Designed following Vastu principles, the room is positioned to ensure positive energy flow and ventilation.
A guest room that also serves as an office space when needed. Features a balcony and ample natural light with a focus on creating a serene environment for visitors or working professionals.
Dedicated home office with large east-facing windows to enhance morning brightness, soundproofing features, and ergonomic design. Fully accessible layout for wheelchair users.
Accessible bathroom designed with a barrier-free shower, grab bars, and an open layout to maximize light and ventilation.
A compact utility area for laundry and storage. Includes accessible design features and sufficient natural lighting through small windows.

openings.description: Large, double-glazed windows designed to maximize natural light and ventilation while maintaining energy efficiency. East-facing for optimal morning sunlight in accordance with Vastu principles.
Wide doors exceeding 36 inches for wheelchair accessibility, with smooth thresholds to ensure ease of movement.

notes.vastu_considerations: Rooms are oriented to harness natural energy flow. The master bedroom and home office face east for positive energy, while living spaces open up to the south to encourage circulation.
notes.wheelchair_accessibility: All areas are designed with barrier-free access, ramped entries where necessary, and wider doorways to ensure smooth wheelchair navigation.
